alert.note: Alert for Big Hole Mountains; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Teton Valley; Upper Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 09 at 2:25PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: For lower elevations, tonight through tomorrow morning look for 1 to 3 inches of snow for the Upper Snake Plain, Teton Valley, and the Caribou Range. For higher elevations, especially for the Big Holes, and, to a lesser degree, the Caribou Range look for 3 to 7 inches. Expect around 3 inches of snow for Pine Creek Pass. The GFS and ECMWF ensembles are suggesting that Driggs could get up to 5 to 6 inches of snow. The NBM 4.1 model 24 hour probability shows a 29% chance for Driggs to get 4 inches of snow. It shows the Big Hole mtns with a 70 to 80% chance to get 4 inches this evening into tomorrow morning. Currently have 1.5 inches in the forecast for Idaho Falls. There is a 46% chance for Idaho Falls to get 2 inches of snow according the NBM 4.1 model. Northerly winds and southwest winds are converging on a line from approx. Idaho Falls to the Big Holes/Wyoming line explaining higher snow amounts. If this converge line moves farther north or farther south, snow amounts will change.
